alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 5:04PM EDT until July 03 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Broome. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional newly developing storms will cause rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Binghamton, Johnson City, Endicott, Vestal, Kirkwood, Conklin, Chenango Bridge, Chenango Forks, Sanitaria Springs, Endwell, Vestal Center, West Corners, Union Center, Harpursville, Port Dickinson, Port Crane, Chenango Valley State Park and Belden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
